basis: The user emphasizes optionality and non-commitment ('might try', 'I'll decide then') rather than a definite action. This indicates a tentative but possible in-moment action, placing the estimate around the low-to-mid range.
cognitive_dissonance: Conflicting goals: wanting to avoid rigid routines and obligation while still considering a tiny bite when it feels right; anxiety about eating schedules clashes with body cues.
negative_thought_patterns: All-or-nothing expectations about routines; fear of eating as a 'rule'; possible guilt if not eating; worry that any attempt will provoke anxiety.
emotional_triggers: Routines and schedule pressure; inconsistent appetite; anxiety about making the wrong choice; fear of negative outcomes from eating.
coaching_notes: Keep offering ultra-flexible, in-the-moment choices. Reinforce that skipping is acceptable and normal. Use micro-actions (tiny bite or sip) only if truly felt to be safe. Avoid pressure or attributions of success/failure; focus on ongoing check-ins and self-trust.
